description: Construction of seven, two storey terraced houses with roofspace accomodation, associated access, landscaping and refuse storage (following demolition of two semi-detached dwellings)
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the approved plans: NH14-L-01; NH14-L-02; NH14-GA-P-00 Rev E; NH14-GA-P-01 Rev D; NH14-GA-P-02 Rev B; NH14-GA-P-03 Rev B; NH14-GA-E-01 Rev C; NH14-CO-01; NH14-GA-E-02 Rev B; NH14-GA-P-00; NH14-GA-P-00 (Trees); NH14-GA-P-00 (Landscaping) Rev A; 2015-2273-AT-301;  2015-2273-AT-302;  Daylight, Sunlight and Overshadowing Report (prepared by JW Associates and dated 16th Janurary 2015); Code for Sustainable Homes 2010 (2013 Addendum) Pre-assessment Report (prepared by Verte Ltd and dated December 2014); Tree Survey, Arboricultural Impact Assessment and Tree Protection Plan (prepared by Dr. Martin Dobson and dated 4 December 2014); and Planning and Design Statement   REASON: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning. | Samples of the materials to be used for the external surfaces of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application.  Development shall be carried out only in accordance with the approved details and permanently retained thereafter.  REASON: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1, 2.1 & 2.10 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 & 7.6 of the London Plan (2015), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | Notwithstanding the provisions of Classes A, B, C, D E and F of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995 (or any subsequent order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modifications),  no enlargement, improvement or other alteration to the dwellinghouse hereby approved shall be carried out without the prior permission of the Local Planning Authority, obtained through the submission of a planning application.  REASON: To prevent the overdevelopment of the site to safeguard the living conditions of adjoining properties and the visual appearance of the buildings and the area as a whole,  in accordance with policies 1.1 (g) (h), 1.2 (f), 3.1(b) and 3.8 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 and 7B of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), and policies 3.5, 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2015). | The refuse and recycling storage shall be implemented in accordance with the Local Planning Authority policies before the first occupation of any of the dwellings hereby approved and retained permanently thereafter. This area shall not be used for any other purpose.  REASON: To provide adequate refuse and recycling storage to protect the amenities of the area and the living conditions of occupiers of the proposed residential units and the surrounding area, in accordance with policy 7B of the adopted Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), and policies 5.3 and 5.16 of the London Plan (2015). | No occupation of the dwelling hereby approved shall take place until full details of boundary treatments and hard/soft landscaping works (including private external areas and shared surface materials at the front) and a phased programme of works, have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and these works shall be completed as approved prior to the occupation of any part of the development or in accordance with the programme agreed by the Local Planning Authority. Any trees or other plants which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme shall be replaced during the next planting season.  REASON: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the visual interests of the character and appearance of the area and that the internal hard landscaping is suitably integrated with the public highway and associated highway works, and to provide screening of the proposal from neighbouring properties, and in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7B of the Adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), and policies 3.5, 7.4, 7.6 and 7.21 of the London Plan (2015). | A surface drainage scheme based on sustainable drainage principles shall be implemented prior to the first occupation of the dwelling hereby approved and retained thereafter.  REASON: To ensure the drainage measures comply with Thames Water/Environment Agency requirements, and to prevent the increased risk of flooding in accordance with policy 5.12 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013); policies 1.1 (k) and 1.2 (m) of Ealing's Development Strategy 2026; policies 5.12, 5.13 and 5.14 of the London Plan 2015 and section 10 of the National Planning Policy Framework. | Notwithstanding any information submitted with this application, the residential unit hereby approved shall be constructed to achieve to a minimum Level 4 of the Code for Sustainable Homes in respect of access, internal floor space, water efficiency and energy. The associated reports/ assessment and certifications to demonstrate compliance shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval as follows:  - After commencement of development. Within 3 months of the commencement of the development, evidence that the development is registered with the Building Research Establishment (BRE) under the Code for Sustainable Homes latest technical guidance and CfSH Interim Design Stage Assessment and Certificate verified by the BRE will be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval.  - After completion of Development  Within 3 months from the date of first occupation of the development, CfSH Post-Construction Stage Assessment and Certificate verified by the BRE will be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval confirming that the agreed sustainability measures have been implemented.   Following any approval of a 'Post Construction Stage' assessment and certificate of the development, the approved measures and technologies to achieve the CfSH Level 4 shall be retained in working order in perpetuity.     REASON: To ensure a sustainable living environment is secured in accordance with policy 5.2G of Ealing Development Management DPD (10th December 2013), Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2026 (3rd April 2012) and policies 5.1, 5.2, 5.3, 5.5, 5.6, 5.7 and 5.9 of the London Plan 2015. | Notwithstanding any details submitted with this application, the windows serving the northern and southern elevations shall be fully obscured glazed and fixed shut 1.7m and above internal floor level.   REASON: To ensure privacy of prospective occupiers of the dwelling and neighbouring sites in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7B of the Adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), and policies 3.5, 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2015). | Prior to the commencement of the development a Construction Management Plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The means of site management and construction shall be carried out only in accordance with the approved Strategy. This shall also include details of the means of access for construction works and details of noise, vibration and dust mitigation measures during the redevelopment which should directly cross-reference with the BPM & mitigation measures as detailed in the following guidance:  i.	'Guidance on the Assessment of the Impacts of Construction on Air Quality and the Determination of their Significance', IAQM, December 2011 ii.	'The  control of dust and emissions from Construction and Demolition' Draft SPG, GLA,2013 iii.	BS 5228-1:2009 - Code of practice for noise & vibration control on construction & open sites-Part 1: Noise  Reason: To protect the living conditions of nearby occupiers and in the interests of highway safety and environmental amenity in accordance with the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 6.11, 6.14, 7.4 and 7.15 of the London Plan (2015), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | The development hereby approved shall comply with the standards of Secured By Design, be implemented before the first occupation of the development, and shall be permanently retained thereafter.    Reason: In the interest of the safety of the occupiers and visitors to the premises, in accordance with the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.1 and 7.3 of the London Plan (2015), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).
